body:
This feels like one of those obnoxious replies on questions asked on Amazon products.
Question: "Does this cat food have soy in it"
Answer: "I don't know, I didn't read the ingredients before buying it." 

FFS, then why did you answer.

body: From what I have heard before, the admins add people who asked for it to a list and then they randomly pick users from the list. Users chosen then get to see new features before they go out and give out their opinion and criticism of these new features. Like I said this is what I've heard awhile back so I'm not sure if what I just said is 100% true.
body_html: From what I have heard before, the admins add people who asked for it to a list and then they randomly pick users from the list. Users chosen then get to see new features before they go out and give out their opinion and criticism of these new features. Like I said this is what I've heard awhile back so I'm not sure if what I just said is 100% true.

body: I don't know how they pick users off the list but I do remember Kek saying it can't be shown to too many people at once because it builds up too much hype and expectations for features that may or may not even be kept and released later on.

body: That just sounds like an excuse to me. Not saying they're doing this on purpose but there does seem to be a clique of certain users that they give a larger role in ruqqus than anyone else, and I wouldn't doubt that they're the ones in the focus group too. It's frustrating seeing that happen if you're not a part of it, and not only that, but it could easily become a cabal if it goes on for too many years.
body_html: That just sounds like an excuse to me. Not saying they're doing this on purpose but there does seem to be a clique of certain users that they give a larger role in ruqqus than anyone else, and I wouldn't doubt that they're the ones in the focus group too. It's frustrating seeing that happen if you're not a part of it, and not only that, but it could easily become a cabal if it goes on for too many years.

post.title: What is the Ruqqus "focus group"?

author.bio:
Status: writing ruqqus documentation

"I want married trans couples to be able to defend their cocaine farms with full-auto rifles."

![](https://i.ibb.co/MkTJgnn/giphy.gif)
author.bio_html:
Status: writing ruqqus documentation

"I want married trans couples to be able to defend their cocaine farms with full-auto rifles."

body:
For info on focus groups in general https://www.nngroup.com/articles/focus-groups/

The #FocusGroup channel is a small, gated channel to collect feedback on and discuss experimental designs. The ideas fleshed out in these designs are discussed publicly in #feature-requests and #theory-of-ruqqus.

We keep it closed for a few reasons. Focus groups are meant to be small; we sometimes have voice calls with these users and we have to keep things focused and on track. Public channels are hectic. As we develop testable interfaces, we'll cycle focus group members in and out. The needs of the lurker are different than that of the guild master, so there's different tiers of users to collect feedback from.

Secondly, our design work is done in-house. We've had people come into the discord with the intent to gain access to proprietary information. We've seen our UIs ripped before as well. And while current ruqqus is heavily influenced by reddit design, future iterations will not be.
body_html:
For info on focus groups in general https://www.nngroup.com/articles/focus-groups/

The #FocusGroup channel is a small, gated channel to collect feedback on and discuss experimental designs. The ideas fleshed out in these designs are discussed publicly in #feature-requests and #theory-of-ruqqus.

We keep it closed for a few reasons. Focus groups are meant to be small; we sometimes have voice calls with these users and we have to keep things focused and on track. Public channels are hectic. As we develop testable interfaces, we'll cycle focus group members in and out. The needs of the lurker are different than that of the guild master, so there's different tiers of users to collect feedback from.

Secondly, our design work is done in-house. We've had people come into the discord with the intent to gain access to proprietary information. We've seen our UIs ripped before as well. And while current ruqqus is heavily influenced by reddit design, future iterations will not be.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs
guild.name: Ruqqus

parent.body:
For info on focus groups in general https://www.nngroup.com/articles/focus-groups/

The #FocusGroup channel is a small, gated channel to collect feedback on and discuss experimental designs. The ideas fleshed out in these designs are discussed publicly in #feature-requests and #theory-of-ruqqus.

We keep it closed for a few reasons. Focus groups are meant to be small; we sometimes have voice calls with these users and we have to keep things focused and on track. Public channels are hectic. As we develop testable interfaces, we'll cycle focus group members in and out. The needs of the lurker are different than that of the guild master, so there's different tiers of users to collect feedback from.

Secondly, our design work is done in-house. We've had people come into the discord with the intent to gain access to proprietary information. We've seen our UIs ripped before as well. And while current ruqqus is heavily influenced by reddit design, future iterations will not be.
parent.body_html:
For info on focus groups in general https://www.nngroup.com/articles/focus-groups/

The #FocusGroup channel is a small, gated channel to collect feedback on and discuss experimental designs. The ideas fleshed out in these designs are discussed publicly in #feature-requests and #theory-of-ruqqus.

We keep it closed for a few reasons. Focus groups are meant to be small; we sometimes have voice calls with these users and we have to keep things focused and on track. Public channels are hectic. As we develop testable interfaces, we'll cycle focus group members in and out. The needs of the lurker are different than that of the guild master, so there's different tiers of users to collect feedback from.

Secondly, our design work is done in-house. We've had people come into the discord with the intent to gain access to proprietary information. We've seen our UIs ripped before as well. And while current ruqqus is heavily influenced by reddit design, future iterations will not be.

post.body: I heard rumors of a private channel in the Ruqqus discord called #focus-group, where the admins supposedly have advisors who discuss new ideas with them. However, the admins have not mentioned anything about this so far. Is it true, and if so how does it work?
post.body_html: I heard rumors of a private channel in the Ruqqus discord called #focus-group, where the admins supposedly have advisors who discuss new ideas with them. However, the admins have not mentioned anything about this so far. Is it true, and if so how does it work?
post.title: What is the Ruqqus "focus group"?

author.bio:
Status: writing ruqqus documentation

"I want married trans couples to be able to defend their cocaine farms with full-auto rifles."

![](https://i.ibb.co/MkTJgnn/giphy.gif)
author.bio_html:
Status: writing ruqqus documentation

"I want married trans couples to be able to defend their cocaine farms with full-auto rifles."

body:
Third point I forgot to mention was user expectations. If I shared every Figma mockup and design publically; there'd be a barrage of questions and comments on "when is this feature coming", "when is this being added", etc.

>So what you're saying is there are certain users that you and the other admins know personally and get selected for these kinds of things?

No, we don't know them personally. Arkitekt and captainmeta4 are not as involved in the focus group channel as I am. iirc cap hasn't used it at all.
 
To quell any concerns over a "cabal", the focus group is purely a UI/UX deal. And again, as we get closer to a testable beta (vue refactor), we will open it up to more users and collect more feedback.
body_html:
Third point I forgot to mention was user expectations. If I shared every Figma mockup and design publically; there'd be a barrage of questions and comments on "when is this feature coming", "when is this being added", etc.

So what you're saying is there are certain users that you and the other admins know personally and get selected for these kinds of things?

No, we don't know them personally. Arkitekt and captainmeta4 are not as involved in the focus group channel as I am. iirc cap hasn't used it at all.

To quell any concerns over a "cabal", the focus group is purely a UI/UX deal. And again, as we get closer to a testable beta (vue refactor), we will open it up to more users and collect more feedback.

parent.body: That just sounds like an excuse to me. Not saying they're doing this on purpose but there does seem to be a clique of certain users that they give a larger role in ruqqus than anyone else, and I wouldn't doubt that they're the ones in the focus group too. It's frustrating seeing that happen if you're not a part of it, and not only that, but it could easily become a cabal if it goes on for too many years.

body:
> Third point I forgot to mention was user expectations. If I shared every Figma mockup and design publically; there'd be a barrage of questions and comments on "when is this feature coming", "when is this being added", etc.

Just don't answer them then.

> No, we don't know them personally. Arkitekt and captainmeta4 are not as involved in the focus group channel as I am. iirc cap hasn't used it at all.

By "personally" I don't necessarily mean in real life, I just mean online friends.

> To quell any concerns over a "cabal", the focus group is purely a UI/UX deal. And again, as we get closer to a testable beta (vue refactor), we will open it up to more users and collect more feedback.

It's still bad to let a gated group of users not affiliated with the company have access to insider information. And I'm not saying the focus group itself is a cabal, but I would guess that it has a lot of the same people that you've selected for other roles as well. Does it?
body_html:
Third point I forgot to mention was user expectations. If I shared every Figma mockup and design publically; there'd be a barrage of questions and comments on "when is this feature coming", "when is this being added", etc.

Just don't answer them then.

No, we don't know them personally. Arkitekt and captainmeta4 are not as involved in the focus group channel as I am. iirc cap hasn't used it at all.

By "personally" I don't necessarily mean in real life, I just mean online friends.

To quell any concerns over a "cabal", the focus group is purely a UI/UX deal. And again, as we get closer to a testable beta (vue refactor), we will open it up to more users and collect more feedback.

It's still bad to let a gated group of users not affiliated with the company have access to insider information. And I'm not saying the focus group itself is a cabal, but I would guess that it has a lot of the same people that you've selected for other roles as well. Does it?

body:
I'm not going to mention specific users; but the vast majority of users in the focus group are not part of other groups.

>Just don't answer them then.

We're not sharing every mockup and design iteration for the same reason tech companies don't share their own. It's a waste of time.
body_html:
I'm not going to mention specific users; but the vast majority of users in the focus group are not part of other groups.

Just don't answer them then.

We're not sharing every mockup and design iteration for the same reason tech companies don't share their own. It's a waste of time.

body:
> I'm not going to mention specific users; but the vast majority of users in the focus group are not part of other groups.

I don't need or want names. You say vast majority, does that imply that those who are part of other groups are also in the focus group, despite not making up the majority of it?

> We're not sharing every mockup and design iteration for the same reason tech companies don't share their own. It's a waste of time.

Wouldn't it take the same amount of time to share it with the focus group? You could allow people to opt into testing and whenever there's an experimental feature, send their account a message which can't be replied to. Then feedback could be in a feature testing guild instead. I can create one right now if you want me to.
body_html:
I'm not going to mention specific users; but the vast majority of users in the focus group are not part of other groups.

I don't need or want names. You say vast majority, does that imply that those who are part of other groups are also in the focus group, despite not making up the majority of it?

We're not sharing every mockup and design iteration for the same reason tech companies don't share their own. It's a waste of time.

Wouldn't it take the same amount of time to share it with the focus group? You could allow people to opt into testing and whenever there's an experimental feature, send their account a message which can't be replied to. Then feedback could be in a feature testing guild instead. I can create one right now if you want me to.

body:
https://product-hunt-radio.simplecast.com/episodes/how-to-design-products-that-delight-your-users-with-slacks-vp-of-design-ethan-eismann?t=34m32s

>Wouldn't it take the same amount of time to share it with the focus group?

No, focus groups are very small for this reason. The first link I shared has more info on this.

Check out the link I shared if you're interested in how Slack does this with shared channels. Again, it's about managing expectations. It is not practical to share every mockup and prototype with hundreds of people.
body_html:
https://product-hunt-radio.simplecast.com/episodes/how-to-design-products-that-delight-your-users-with-slacks-vp-of-design-ethan-eismann?t=34m32s

Wouldn't it take the same amount of time to share it with the focus group?

No, focus groups are very small for this reason. The first link I shared has more info on this.

Check out the link I shared if you're interested in how Slack does this with shared channels. Again, it's about managing expectations. It is not practical to share every mockup and prototype with hundreds of people.

guild.description:
The official guild for all things Ruqqus.

Rules:

💻 No promotion of other sites that aren't a fork of Ruqqus

🟪 Ruqqus-related only. This is a community dedicated to Ruqqus meta discussion. Content may involve technology and politics but must have ample context in Ruqqus.

📬 No spamming. Spamming comments or posts is not allowed.

😀 Be civil. Be nice. Harassment, trolling, and disruptive behavior is not allowed. Basically, don’t be a jerk.

📜 Follow Ruqqus ToS. This is a given.

For press releases, visit +RuqqusPress.

For updates and patch notes, visit +changelog.

For ideas and feedback, visit +BetaFeedback

For bug reports, visit +RuqqusBugs

parent.body:
> I'm not going to mention specific users; but the vast majority of users in the focus group are not part of other groups.

I don't need or want names. You say vast majority, does that imply that those who are part of other groups are also in the focus group, despite not making up the majority of it?

> We're not sharing every mockup and design iteration for the same reason tech companies don't share their own. It's a waste of time.

Wouldn't it take the same amount of time to share it with the focus group? You could allow people to opt into testing and whenever there's an experimental feature, send their account a message which can't be replied to. Then feedback could be in a feature testing guild instead. I can create one right now if you want me to.
parent.body_html:
I'm not going to mention specific users; but the vast majority of users in the focus group are not part of other groups.

I don't need or want names. You say vast majority, does that imply that those who are part of other groups are also in the focus group, despite not making up the majority of it?

We're not sharing every mockup and design iteration for the same reason tech companies don't share their own. It's a waste of time.

Wouldn't it take the same amount of time to share it with the focus group? You could allow people to opt into testing and whenever there's an experimental feature, send their account a message which can't be replied to. Then feedback could be in a feature testing guild instead. I can create one right now if you want me to.

post.body: I heard rumors of a private channel in the Ruqqus discord called #focus-group, where the admins supposedly have advisors who discuss new ideas with them. However, the admins have not mentioned anything about this so far. Is it true, and if so how does it work?
post.body_html: I heard rumors of a private channel in the Ruqqus discord called #focus-group, where the admins supposedly have advisors who discuss new ideas with them. However, the admins have not mentioned anything about this so far. Is it true, and if so how does it work?
post.title: What is the Ruqqus "focus group"?
